title: In loading screen, if one player never connects, RESTART THE QUEUE
body:
It's just too painful to watch one of my member not connecting to the game for some reason, and I don't really like to put my hopes up waiting for him to reconnect during the 1:30 minutes. and who knows? Occasionally, yes, at some point he will reconnect back into game during the 1:30 minute, but also realized that his wifi is pure crap and just declines every 30 seconds, which also responds to why he never connected during loading time. So here's a very simple fix:

During loading screen, where everyone has to reach 100% to connect to game, but if there's one person who stays "Not Connected" til the point the game has to start, restart the queue again. That's it, that's all I ask. But of course, the guy who never connected will not receive punishment from Leaverbuster. Unless if he did get into loading screen with at least 1% in his waiting time & then never connects into game til the queue rrestarts, only then he will receive punishment from Leaverbuster.

If your internet is crap and you're trying to play League, a Team Based game, with SKILL SHOTS, and other things that sometimes require twitch like reflexes, yes. You're basically a liability to your team, and I would be upset that I got matched with someone like that. They've essentially nerfed themselves and now I have to suffer over their net.

I don't have the best net ever, but even my net runs League Smoothly, and it's cheap as all hell. So I would expect the same level of stability from others.

On a side note, if the servers are being shitty, then that's an entirely different issue. The servers should, ideally, have a system in play where it detects where the problem was to fix it. I don't think detecting someone as not connecting because they have 0 net, should be that hard.

Because we can "fix" our ISP throttling our internet. Or how would one fix that problem that the client needs 5 different processes to run, compared to back in the day of only 2.

It's one game that only decreases the speed in which you find a match. That's it, that the next match will take longer to find. This punishes only those that are trying to abuse it in ranked to get out of teams without any penalty by pulling the plug on their internet connection.

Because there's absolutely no way to tell whether or not is was their fault or not, and Riot wants to err on the side of punishing leavers.  "My network card died suddenly" and "I suddenly yanked my Internet cable out of the wall" are pretty much indistinguishable to Riot's servers.  If disconnecting while failing to load isn't punishable, then people that want to queue dodge will just wait until the game starts loading to disconnect.

This can be exploitable:

>Choose champ. Before loading screen, make sure to disconnect from internet.
>Use second connection (let's say phone) and use a lolnexus-like service to see if this team will lead you to victory.
>You have a 20 seconds window to judge and act accordingly.

Suddenly a good number of dodging. Unless they change their policy with information requested by APIs.

Sure you can win 4 on 5 but why should I be held to?

They would have to further investigate the "firewall" error, which for some players like myself, has gone unsolved for years (mine since 2012,) despite the users' best efforts to resolve it. It only takes me 30 seconds to get into the loading screen, but all other players could easily load to 100% in 30 seconds. That means that I'd be unfairly kicked from a number of games, when the entire loading process only takes about 45 seconds for me, even with this error.

Maybe Riot could implement some kind of indicator with a bar which shows the player how fast their internet is at the moment in the Main menu of the client. Then, if the internet (bar) is low enough, that player wouldn't be able to join a matchmade game. 
This would let the Summoner know beforehand if his/her internet is slow before actually starting a game with other players.

What do you guys think about this idea?
